headline: Bolivia Partners El Salvador to Build a Strong Crypto Future
summary: Bolivia is entering a new stage in its financial journey by moving toward crypto adoption. On July 30, 2025, Bolivia‚Äôs Central Bank (BCB) signed an important agreement with El Salvador‚Äôs National Commission of Digital Assets (CNAD). The goal is to collaborate on improving rules for digital assets and developing blockchain technology. This move shows that Bolivia wants a safer and more advanced financial system. A Strategic Partnership to Share Knowledge and Experience The agreement signed between the two countries is called a memorandum of understanding (MoU). This agreement allows both countries to exchange ideas and improve their knowledge of how to regulate and manage digital assets and blockchain technology . The MoU will allow Bolivia and El Salvador to exchange information on crypto laws and regulatory policies. Both countries will join forces to create tools that lower risks and make digital assets safer. They also plan to use blockchain technology to boost transparency and help spot fraud or misuse. The main goal is to build safe, well-regulated systems that support financial progress and new ideas. Learning from El Salvador‚Äôs Crypto Journey El Salvador has led the way in using cryptocurrency. In 2021, it became the first country to make Bitcoin (BTC) an official currency, under President Nayib Bukele. The Central American country continues to expand its Bitcoin reserves and has enacted favourable laws to attract crypto companies. This strategy has attracted major investors, including Tether, a prominent stablecoin issuer. Even though financial groups like the International Monetary Fund (IMF) have criticized the move, El Salvador has stayed focused on its crypto plans . Now, Bolivia wants to learn from El Salvador‚Äôs experience to develop its own digital asset policies. Bolivia‚Äôs Policy Change and Growing Interest in Crypto This partnership follows Bolivia‚Äôs significant shift from strict crypto rules to a more open approach. In June 2024, the government passed Resolution 082/2024, which ended the long-term ban on digital assets. The new law allows crypto trading and digital payments under clear regulations. Since that change, Bolivia has seen a sharp rise in crypto use. In June 2024, crypto transactions were worth around $46.5 million. A year later, the value had grown to nearly $294 million. This shows that people and businesses in Bolivia are quickly adopting digital assets now that they are legal. Bolivia has also started to use crypto for trade. The government has allowed the national oil company, YPFB, to use digital currencies when buying fuel from other countries. This is especially important because Bolivia has been facing problems with foreign currency shortages. This move shows how serious the country is about including crypto in its national economy. The post Bolivia Partners El Salvador to Build a Strong Crypto Future appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

headline: Tether, One of the Largest Cryptocurrency Companies, Releases Its Earnings Report ‚Äì Here Are Its Assets
summary: Tether, the world's largest stablecoin issuer, has published its financial audit report for the second quarter of 2025. According to a report prepared by independent auditing firm BDO, the company issued over $13.4 billion worth of new USDT in the second quarter of the year, bringing the circulating supply to over $157 billion. The total amount of USDT issued since the beginning of the year has reached $20 billion. Tether's total assets reached approximately $162.6 billion as of June 30, 2025. During the same period, its total liabilities stood at $157.1 billion, almost all of which correspond to digital tokens in circulation. The company's assets exceeding its liabilities, according to the press release, demonstrate its strong financial structure, while its shareholder equity of approximately $5.47 billion is noteworthy. Tether's reliance on US Treasury securities has reached a staggering level. The company holds $105.5 billion in direct US Treasury securities and $21.3 billion in indirect US Treasury securities. This makes Tether one of the largest global buyers of US debt, holding over $127 billion in total US debt. The company generated approximately $4.9 billion in net profit in the second quarter of 2025. Total net profit for the first six months of the year was $5.7 billion. $3.1 billion of this figure came from regular operating income and $2.6 billion from the market valuation of its gold and Bitcoin holdings. A significant portion of these profits was channeled into strategic investments. Tether continues to channel its growing profitability into long-term projects. Among the investments made in the last six months, projects like XXI Capital, Rumble, and the Rumble Wallet development stand out. The US has received the largest share of these investments, with a total of nearly $4 billion in capital being channeled into the local ecosystem. Related News: Experienced Analyst Introduces Special Metric: Is Bitcoin Price Likely to Go Up or Down? Here Are the Results Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino stated that the company's influence in the global financial system is growing. ‚ÄúWith over $127 billion in US Treasury positions, strong gold and Bitcoin reserves, and over $20 billion in new USDT issued in 2025, we are not only responding to demand, we are also shaping the future of the digital dollar,‚Äù Ardoino said. Tether's key financial data as of Q2 2025 is as follows: Total Assets: $162.57 billion Total Liabilities: $157.1 billion Net Profit (Q2 2025): ~$4.9 billion USDT in circulation: $157 billion US Treasury Bond Position: $127 billion *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Tether, One of the Largest Cryptocurrency Companies, Releases Its Earnings Report ‚Äì Here Are Its Assets

headline: Top Crypto Gainers in 2025: BlockDAG‚Äôs 10 BTC Auction Sets the Bar as Bitcoin Hyper, Nexchain, & Lightchain AI Follow
summary: Identifying the top crypto gainers in 2025 is no longer only about strong utility or widespread attention. The real standouts are projects that engage communities, offer real rewards, and use new approaches to drive involvement. With numerous assets vying for space, only a few have found ways to push past the noise. This article outlines four crypto projects currently making measurable progress, with BlockDAG leading due to its record-setting 10 BTC Auction and impressive presale figures. 1. BlockDAG: Redefining Presales with Its 10 BTC Auction BlockDAG has transformed its crypto presale into a global countdown that breaks from traditional promotion methods. Instead of depending on influencers or hype, the project launched a 10 BTC Auction that offers a reward pool of 10 Bitcoin for purchases made before August 11. Larger purchases secure a bigger portion of the prize, creating both urgency and participation. The response has been significant. BlockDAG has raised $357 million so far, sold over 24.5 billion BDAG coins, and reached Batch 29, now priced at $0.0276. This represents a 2,660% increase since its initial batch. Despite being this far along, the GLOBAL LAUNCH release gives buyers one more opportunity to purchase BDAG at just $0.0016 for a limited period. The project also confirms more than 20 exchange listings, providing day-one liquidity. From a marketing and strategy viewpoint, the 10 BTC Auction is not just a giveaway but a model others may follow. That is why BlockDAG sits confidently at the top of the list of the top crypto gainers in 2025. 2. Nexchain: Streamlining Cross-Chain Interaction Nexchain is among the newer platforms that focus on cross-chain operations without relying on centralized solutions. It allows value and data to move between different blockchains without external bridges. Interoperability is widely considered a key to broader adoption, but it has been difficult to achieve efficiently. What gives Nexchain its edge is the protocol-level design. Rather than making users switch tokens or platforms, it provides a seamless process. Developers can build decentralized apps that work across ecosystems without needing to manage separate technical frameworks. As the demand for cross-chain capabilities increases, Nexchain becomes more relevant. Its user-friendly interface and flexible developer tools give it long-term appeal. Those watching infrastructure-driven growth should view Nexchain as one of the top crypto gainers in 2025. 3. Bitcoin Hyper: Fixing Speed & Simplicity in Payments Bitcoin Hyper has drawn attention for directly addressing two of Bitcoin‚Äôs biggest issues: transaction speed and scalability. It promotes a lightweight network that is fast, low-cost, and built for real-time payments. While it does not aim to replace Bitcoin, it complements it by solving problems that have held it back. Its appeal lies in its focus on simple and efficient transactions. Users can send payments quickly without needing to understand complex processes. This makes Bitcoin Hyper a practical option, particularly in areas where traditional banking remains slow or costly. Although still in its growth phase, Bitcoin Hyper‚Äôs focus on real-world use over speculation places it among the top crypto gainers in 2025 for those who value function and ease of adoption. 4. Lightchain AI: Integrating AI into Blockchain Workflows Lightchain AI aims to enhance blockchain systems by embedding machine learning models directly into smart contracts. This allows decentralized apps to react to real-time data, enabling them to perform intelligent actions instead of following fixed commands. For example, prediction platforms could update in real time, and logistics chains could identify issues and respond immediately. What makes Lightchain AI distinct is its clear focus on real AI integration. Rather than using AI as a marketing label, the project has launched actual tools for developers to build smart contracts powered by machine learning. More tools are expected through open APIs soon. By making blockchain systems smarter, Lightchain AI offers a forward-looking utility. Although still developing, it has a clear path. If AI keeps shaping digital infrastructure, Lightchain AI could become a vital component. It deserves a spot on the list of top crypto gainers in 2025 for those following AI utility trends. Choosing Among the Top Crypto Gainers in 2025 As 2025 moves closer, people are no longer picking coins based solely on trends or market noise. They want meaningful rewards, real use cases, and strategies that last. BlockDAG stands out for combining all three. Its 10 BTC Auction and smart presale strategy give it an edge as the top choice among the top crypto gainers in 2025 . At the same time, Bitcoin Hyper, Nexchain, and Lightchain AI each offer strong answers to long-standing crypto issues. Whether through faster payments, easier cross-chain interaction, or AI-based systems, these projects focus on building real solutions. Their progress shows that the next market leaders will not just talk about utility but prove it. Disclaimer: This is a sponsored press release for informational purposes only. It does not reflect the views of Times Tabloid, nor is it intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, or financial advice. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. headline: Bitcoin New Investor Dominance Rises ‚Äì No Signs of Mass Profit-Taking Yet
summary: Bitcoin‚Äôs new investor dominance is gaining momentum just as the asset consolidates in a tight range, setting the stage for a major breakout. After more than two weeks of sideways movement between $115,000 and $120,000, BTC continues to trade within this well-defined range‚Äîbuilding pressure that typically precedes a sharp move. Related Reading: Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase Signals Market Sits Between Accumulation And Distribution Data from CryptoQuant highlights a crucial dynamic: the comparison between demand and supply from new versus old investors. The current new investor dominance sits at 30%, only half of the ‚Äúoverheated‚Äù range of 60‚Äì70% seen during euphoric phases, but the trend is clearly climbing. This means new liquidity is entering the market steadily, while old holders are still distributing at a manageable pace. The supply of long-term holders is absorbing this growing young demand without disrupting the price structure. This healthy balance suggests that the market is still in a stable late bull phase, with no signs of mass profit-taking or capitulation from seasoned investors. With Bitcoin maintaining a bullish structure and demand from fresh entrants rising, the coming days will be critical. Bitcoin Enters Healthy Late Bull Phase as New Investor Activity Grows Top analyst Axel Adler recently shared detailed insights into Bitcoin‚Äôs market structure, focusing on the balance between new and old investor behavior. According to Adler, previous peaks in new investor dominance‚Äî64% in March 2024 and 72% in December 2024‚Äîaligned precisely with local BTC price tops. At those points, new liquidity began to wane, and experienced holders ramped up profit-taking. Currently, new investor dominance stands at 30%, which is still far from those overheated extremes. However, the trend is upward. The purple fill on the chart, which reflects cumulative activity from younger coins, has been climbing steadily since July 2024. This indicates that a fresh wave of buyers continues to enter the market, while selling pressure from old hands remains limited. This dynamic creates room for further bullish continuation before the typical euphoria zone‚Äîabove 60‚Äì70% dominance‚Äîtakes hold. Old holders are still distributing coins, but only moderately. A coefficient of 0.3 means that three-year-old coins are absorbing demand without triggering major volatility. This balance suggests that the market remains structurally sound. Related Reading: BlackRock Goes Heavy on Ethereum: Buys 4x More ETH Than BTC Bitcoin Forms A Tight Consolidation Range Bitcoin is currently trading at $118,413, consolidating in a narrow range between $115,724 and $122,077, as seen in the 8-hour chart. This sideways movement has persisted for over two weeks, indicating indecision in the market. The key support sits at $115,724, which has been tested multiple times but held firmly, while the $122,077 level acts as immediate resistance after a strong rejection earlier in July. The price remains above the 50, 100, and 200-period moving averages, which now align in bullish order‚Äîanother sign that the underlying trend is still intact despite short-term consolidation. Volume remains relatively low, suggesting that neither bulls nor bears are aggressively positioning at the moment. However, such tight ranges often precede large directional moves. Related Reading: Bitcoin Long-Term Holders Begin Distribution: Mirroring Fall 2024 Cycle If bulls manage to break above the $122K resistance with strong volume, it could trigger a continuation toward new highs. On the other hand, a breakdown below the $115.7K support would expose downside risk. Potentially leading to a retest of the 100-period moving average around $114,490 or even the 200-period average near $110,188. Featured image from Dall-E, chart from TradingView
